name: Dinner Tonight: Roasted Beet Salad
description: At the Logan Square Farmers' Market in Chicago recently, I came across yellow beets and was told they are sweeter than regular red ones. Whether that's true or not, I was sold. I just had to think of how to...
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 pounds beets, stems removed and washed
1 Serrano chile, seed and thinly chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Sprinkle the beets with salt and a tablespoon of the olive oil. Wrap in aluminum foil, leaving a little hole in the top facing up, and set in a roasting pan. Cook until easily pierced with a knife, about 45 minutes or until very tender.
Meanwhile, mix together the rest of the olive oil, red onion, Serrano, ginger, cilantro, sugar, and red wine vinegar.
When beets are done and cool enough to handle, peel and chop into 1/2 inch pieces.
Mix with the rest of the ingredients. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.
